title: iOS Unread Message Bug
body:
I had submitted a support ticket and the support specialist redirected me here; see support request 20733064 for the screenshot I attached.

**System**

iPhone 6 w/ iOS 9.2.1 (13D20); there are actually two versions of iOS 9.2.1 depending if you did an over the air update or update via iTunes; this is the newer of the builds which you only pick up via iTunes if you had the first 9.2.1 already installed or if you upgraded after they hot fixed the install.

**Description**

At the top of the screen on the chats pane there is a MESSAGES (X) where X is the number of unread messages. This number is reflected by the red circle near the chat icon that you click to go to this pain that contains X as well. Finally, the app icon displays that same number if you have badges enabled (which I do).

For me, X is currently 5. At the time of the bug report, that number was 2. The thing is, I have no chats at all (I cleared them all as part of my debugging after opening every chat and making sure I read every message failed to clear it).

It is kind of funny to see "MESSAGES (5)" followed by a sad poro with "You don't have any messages!".

**Possible Steps to Reproduce**

For awhile, I was stuck at 2, and it would increase from there when new messages would come in and then return to 2 when I read them. Last night when I hit 5 as the new 'zero', I took note of exactly what happened.

1. In client (i.e. in game,  not mobile), an individual I had not spoken to in some time messaged me. I responded and had a very brief chat with them (they sent me a total of 3 messages). All were read in client.
2. About a 1/2 hour after shutting down my client (maybe an hour after the convo ended), my notifications fired on my iPhone that the LoL Chat application had new messages (3 notifications).
3. Unlocking the phone showed the app icon badge with a value of 5.
4. Opening the app revealed my conversation I had in client had arrived to my phone (even though they were already read in client).
5. Opening the conversation did not return the unread count to 2 (which for me has been "zero").
6. Clearing the conversation did not return the unread count to 2.
7. My new zero is now 5.

Other possibly relevant data: My PC and iPhone share the same network.

replies.body: Thanks for the awesome report along with the detailed steps to repro!  We've been working on fixing the "haunting mystery message" and hope to give you accurate counts in the next one to two releases.  We're also working on improving the experience of chatting in the client then hopping on mobile.
No problem. Let me know if you need any more information and I will do my best to provide it.
